description: Multi-class classification involves categorizing data points into one of several classes. This is a common problem in various fields, including image recognition, medical diagnosis, and natural language processing.
you_have_this_if: You need to classify data into more than two categories.
Your dataset contains multiple classes with varying characteristics.
You are facing challenges in achieving high accuracy across all classes.
You have limited labeled data for training your models.
You require interpretability in your classification results.

approaches.best_for: When you need to classify images of potato leaves for disease detection and require interpretability.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Provides interpretability but may require significant computational resources.

approaches.best_for: When you need to classify histopathology images for breast cancer diagnosis while reducing computational resources.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Efficient model with high accuracy but may not be as interpretable.

approaches.best_for: When you need to classify plant diseases from smartphone imagery, especially with imbalanced datasets.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Good for imbalanced datasets but may require more data for optimal performance.

approaches.technique: Multitask Deep Learning for Heavy Metal Detection
approaches.best_for: When monitoring heavy metal contamination across large areas with multiple contaminants.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Simultaneous detection of multiple classes but may require specialized data.

approaches.technique: Neural Ensemble Architecture with Pseudo-Random Input Sequence
approaches.best_for: When classifying multiple classes of diabetes with limited training data.
approaches.key_tradeoff: Improves accuracy but may increase complexity in model training.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a model that provides both high accuracy and interpretability for image classification.
You want to classify images efficiently while maintaining high accuracy.
You are dealing with smartphone imagery and need to classify imbalanced datasets.

decision_matrix.technique: Multitask Deep Learning for Heavy Metal Detection
decision_matrix.best_when: You need to monitor multiple contaminants simultaneously across large areas.

decision_matrix.technique: Neural Ensemble Architecture with Pseudo-Random Input Sequence
decision_matrix.best_when: You need to improve accuracy in classifying multiple diabetes types with limited data.

start_here: The recommended first approach for most cases is to start with VGG16 with Grad-CAM if interpretability is crucial, or TokenMixer if you need efficiency and high accuracy.
